title: Arena Stage and Invitrogen Logos - Have you seen this font they share?
content:
You’ve probably seen this font before. Work for [Arena Stage](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022743/http:/www.arenastage.org/) theater in D.C. has been featured in design annuals for several years. The same typeface used in the Arena Restaged logo (I believe) is used in this logo for Invitrogen, a biotech company.

Can anyone help me ID this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022743im_/http:/typophile.com/files/arena-restaged_6350.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022743im_/http:/typophile.com/files/invitrogen_4790.jpg)

 [‹ cooper-ish font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022743/http:/typophile.com/node/49886 "Go to previous forum topic") [Trying to Identify Soap Opera Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022743/http:/typophile.com/node/49750 "Go to next forum topic")
author: DesignGuyMemphis

comments.content:
Oh my. You’re GOOD.

You found in a minute and a half what I failed to find in an hour.

Many, many thanks.
Just one of those faces that is burned on my memory. :^) You’re welcome.
